verbs.description: anathematize (third-person singular simple present anathematizes, present participle anathematizing, simple past and past participle anathematized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause to be, or to declare as, an anathema or evil.
examples: Harvard economist Robert Barro anathematized it as "probably the worst bill that has been put forth since the 1930s" and, in a word, "garbage."
